API_Description: Sets the page transitions for a range of pages in the document.
API_Description_Reason: The method name 'setPageTransitions' suggests it is used to define or modify the transitions between pages in a PDF document.
Returns_Reason: The method is likely used for setting properties and does not need to return a value, as it modifies the document's state.

nStart.description: The 0-based index of the first page in the range for which to set the transitions.
nStart.description_reason: The parameter name 'nStart' implies it specifies the starting page index for the transition settings.
nStart.type_reason: Page indices are typically represented as numbers.

nEnd.description: The 0-based index of the last page in the range for which to set the transitions.
nEnd.description_reason: The parameter name 'nEnd' implies it specifies the ending page index for the transition settings.
nEnd.type_reason: Page indices are typically represented as numbers.

aTrans.description: An array specifying the transition effects to apply to the pages in the specified range.
aTrans.description_reason: The parameter name 'aTrans' suggests it is an array of transition effects, as 'a' often denotes an array and 'Trans' refers to transitions.
aTrans.type_reason: The use of 'a' in 'aTrans' implies an array, which is a common data structure for holding multiple values.
